TEXT: The applicant is a NORP national , born in DATE and living in GPE , GPE
A.
From DATE to DATE , the applicant was an officer ( funkcjonariusz ) of ORG ( PERSON ) and ORG ( Komitet Do Spraw Bezpieczeństwa Publicznego ) .

On DATE ORG of the Union of Fighters for Liberty and Democracy ( Zarząd Wojewódzki PERSON i GPE ) issued a decision granting the applicant the so - called “ veteran status ” ( uprawnienia kombatanckie ) on the basis of the fact :
“ ... that he [ had ] served from DATE to CARDINAL DATE in the [ so - called ] Restored PERCENT . ”
On DATE the ORG issued a decision stating that the applicant should be granted “ veteran status ” also in view of the fact that :
“ ... from DATE to CARDINAL DATE he [ had taken ] part in the armed struggle to consolidate the people ’s power ( brał udział w walkach o utrwalanie władzy ludowej ) . ”

On DATE ORG issued a declaration stating that , from DATE to DATE , the applicant had been an officer of the former ORG and the former ORG and that , from DATE to CARDINAL DATE , “ he had taken part in armed fighting with the reactionary underground resistance forces ” ( brał udział w zbrojnej walce z reakcyjnym podziemiem ) .
On DATE the ORG issued a decision stating that the applicant should be granted “ veteran status ” since :

“ From DATE to CARDINAL DATE he [ had ] served in the Restored PERCENT ; from CARDINAL DATE to CARDINAL JuneCARDINAL he [ had ] served in the allied armies ; from DATE to CARDINAL DATE and from DATE to DATE he [ had taken ] part in the armed struggle to consolidate the people ’s power . ”

Later , on an unspecified date , the applicant retired and , from that date , received a retirement pension and a so - called “ veteran benefit ” ( dodatek kombatancki ) , i.e. a DATE allowance to which only retired veterans were entitled .

On DATE the Director of the Office for Veterans and Persecuted Persons ( PERSON Do PERSON i Osób Represjonowanych ) issued a decision divesting the applicant of the status of veteran under LAW ( CARDINAL ) ( a ) of LAW DATE on NORP and Other Victims of War and Post - war Repression ( Ustawa o kombatantach oraz niektórych osobach będących ofiarami represji wojennych i okresu powojennego ) , read in conjunction with LAW § CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) ( a ) of that LAW . The reasons for this decision read :

“ [ The applicant ] was granted “ veteran status ” by virtue of the decisions issued by ORG on the basis of declarations [ of the relevant military authorities ] , stating that he had taken part in the armed struggle to consolidate the people ’s power and had served in the allied army . [ He was later granted such a status ] on the basis of a declaration issued by ORG on DATE , stating that , from DATE to DATE , he had been an officer of the former ORG and the former ORG and that , from DATE to DATE , he had taken part in armed fighting with [ the so - called ] reactionary underground resistance forces .

Under LAW § DATE ) ( a ) of the PERSON of DATE cited above anyone who has served in organs of the public security service shall not acquire “ veteran status ” [ in any circumstances and for whatever other reasons ] .
Under LAW read together with LAW § CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) ( a ) of the LAW , anyone who has served in organs of the public security service shall be divested of such [ previously acquired ] status .
That being so , the present decision is justified . ”

On DATE the applicant filed an appeal with ORG ( PERSON ) , submitting that the above - mentioned decision had been issued in breach of the rule of law and based on insufficient evidence . He maintained that he had been divested of his status of veteran on the basis of a single circumstance , namely , that he had served in the organs of the public security service , even though he had never committed any condemnable , illegal or immoral act . He stressed that he had never taken part in armed fighting with the underground resistance forces but had acquired “ veteran status ” for his fight for independence of GPE and against the NORP . Finally , the applicant contested the accuracy of the certificates issued by ORG , stating that they were inaccurate .

On DATE ORG held a hearing in the applicant ’s case . On DATE the court gave judgment dismissing the appeal . It held that , under LAW and DATE of the Law of DATE on NORP and Other Victims of War and Post - war Repression , no one who had previously served , or been employed in , the organs of the public security service could receive or retain the status of veteran , whatever his merits . In the instant case , it was clear that the applicant had been an officer of the former ORG and the former ORG ; this fact was , in itself , sufficient under the terms of the Law of DATE to justify the decision to divest him of his previously acquired status . The impugned decision had therefore been taken in conformity with the relevant provisions of the substantive law .
PERSON Relevant domestic law
The Law of DATE on NORP and Other Victims of War and Post - War Repression repealed the PERSON of CARDINAL DATE on the Special Status of Veterans ( LOC o szczególnych uprawnieniach kombatantów ) .

It was enacted in order to regulate the system of granting special privileges attached to the so - called “ veteran status ” and , partly , intended to condemn the political role played by the former NORP machinery ( in particular , the so - called “ Public Security Service ” , “ aparat bezpieczeństwa publicznego ” ) in establishing the NORP regime , implementing a NORP policy and repressing political opposition to the system . Considering that persons having served in the former organs of public security , whose task it had been , inter alia , to combat and eliminate all forms of democratic opposition , did not deserve the special privileges attached to “ veteran status ” , the legislator decided that they should be unconditionally deprived of that status .

The “ Public Security Service ” consisted of ORG organs , comprising the political police and special armed forces . It was patterned after the LAW and the ORG and established ( under the supervision of the FAC ) on DATE with a view to securing NORP rule and combating , suppressing and eliminating groups of political opposition , including the post - war underground resistance against Communism and ORG . In DATE these organs were in charge of prisons and labour camps ; at that time , they were also competent to conduct criminal investigations under the rules of criminal procedure . Depending on the political circumstances , they were called by various names : “ ORG ” ( Resort Bezpieczeństwa Publicznego ) , subsequently renamed “ ORG ” ( PERSON ) ( DATE ) ; “ ORG ” ( PERSON do PERSON ) ( DATE ) ; and “ ORG ” ( PERSON ) , as a special department of ORG ( DATE ; dissolved after the collapse of Communism ) .

The Law of DATE also established a new public organ , the Office for Veterans and ORG , which is competent to grant “ veteran status ” and has the duty to verify whether persons who have previously acquired such status meet the new statutory criteria .
Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) ( a ) of the DATE PERSON , as applicable at the relevant time , provided as follows :
“ CARDINAL . CARDINAL shall acquire “ veteran status ” , if :
( CARDINAL ) ( a ) he has served [ or has been employed ] in organs of the public security service . ... ”
In turn , LAW of that LAW , as applicable at the relevant time , provided the following :
“ Anyone who has acquired “ veteran status ” on the basis referred to in LAW ( CARDINAL ) shall be divested of such previously acquired status . ”

Under the provisions of both the repealed PERSON of CARDINAL DATE and the new LAW DATE ( ORG CARDINAL - CARDINAL ) , veterans were ( and still are ) entitled to privileged status in comparison to other employees or retired persons ; this status included , for example : a lower age of retirement ; a particularly favourable method for calculating periods of employment ; and various financial benefits paid in addition to the normal pension calculated in accordance with the rules of the general social insurance system .

At the time when the applicant was divested of his “ veteran status ” , a retired veteran was , inter alia , entitled to a so - called “ veteran benefit ” equal to PERCENT of the average DATE salary in the public sector ; a fare discount of PERCENT on travel by municipal transport , rail and public long - distance buses ; a special allowance covering PERCENT of such household expenses as electricity , gas and heating ; and a discount of PERCENT on motor - vehicle insurance .

The loss of “ veteran status ” did ( and does ) not , however , entail any legal or practical consequences in respect of the right to receive a normal pension since , under LAW of LAW of DATE , a person divested of that status is still entitled to his pension calculated under the rules applicable within the general social insurance scheme .
